citations.narrative:
The licensee reported that on October 20, 2024 a Swainson’s Hawk escaped from the enclosure. The licensee had
opened the door to replace perching and the hawk flew past them. The hawk has not been recovered despite efforts to
retrieve it. Escaped animals may suffer physical harm, trauma, and stress. The facility must address handling to ensure
animals are handled as expeditiously and carefully as possible to minimize these risks. At the time of inspection corrective
actions made by the facility included installing a curtain to function as a secondary door.
Correct by: 10/22/2024
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “C” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspection(s) or by November 12, 2024 or the applicant will forfeit the
license fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License
Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
n

narrative:
2.131  Critical
   
Handling of animals. 
The licensee reported that on October 20, 2024 a Swainson’s Hawk escaped from the enclosure. The licensee had 
opened the door to replace perching and the hawk flew past them. The hawk has not been recovered despite efforts to 
retrieve it. Escaped animals may suffer physical harm, trauma, and stress. The facility must address handling to ensure 
animals are handled as expeditiously and carefully as possible to minimize these risks. At the time of inspection corrective 
actions made by the facility included installing a curtain to function as a secondary door. 
Correct by: 10/22/2024 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “C” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspection(s) or by November 12, 2024 or the applicant will forfeit the 
license fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License 
Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires. 
 
 n

species.common: RED FOX (INCLUDES SILVER FOX & CROSS FOX)
